snippet.textDisplay: This is great! The one other thing that isn't being covered that I would love to see is how different metro regions or states are doing. I care about the US as a whole, but with the number of different policies being enacted at state and local levels, I want to know whether the Bay Area or Chicago's curves are flattening. People need feedback to know their actions are working (or whether it's time to scale up). Without that, I fear a lot of people will decide it's impossible to coordinate a nationwide response, and will push to remove shelter-in-place orders.
snippet.textOriginal: This is great! The one other thing that isn't being covered that I would love to see is how different metro regions or states are doing. I care about the US as a whole, but with the number of different policies being enacted at state and local levels, I want to know whether the Bay Area or Chicago's curves are flattening. People need feedback to know their actions are working (or whether it's time to scale up). Without that, I fear a lot of people will decide it's impossible to coordinate a nationwide response, and will push to remove shelter-in-place orders.

snippet.textDisplay:
China's numbers improved dramatically when they expelled all Western journalists. Now, we don't know what is actually happening in China, and touting it as a success story is disingenuous at best. If China's numbers are actually correct, then the only other logical conclusion is that the virus is transmitted primarily by Western journalists. This would also explain why the United States, the nation with the most Western journalists, is now leading the World in the number of cases.

While the second explanation is far fetched, we did impeach our president on far less information. (Note: this post is sarcasm.)
snippet.textOriginal:
China's numbers improved dramatically when they expelled all Western journalists.  Now, we don't know what is actually happening in China, and touting it as a success story is disingenuous at best.  If China's numbers are actually correct, then the only other logical conclusion is that the virus is transmitted primarily by Western journalists.  This would also explain why the United States, the nation with the most Western journalists, is now leading the World in the number of cases.  

While the second explanation is far fetched, we did impeach our president on far less information.  (Note: this post is sarcasm.)

snippet.textDisplay: Don't look too much into that graph, it can be very misleading because it doesn't account for differences in population sizes, in testing methods or even in total number of tests (+ the unknown figure which is mentioned). Say Germany and the Netherlands are on the curve, it may look similar, but Germany has 4.5x the population of the Netherlands and 10x the testing. So if you look on that graph Germany may show to be far worse than the NL, simply because it is far ahead on the testing, but if you account for the differences in testing and population size the conclusion is the opposite, that the NL is going into a steeper curve than Germany right now (which also seems to be corroborated by the number of deaths comparisons)
snippet.textOriginal: Don't look too much into that graph, it can be very misleading because it doesn't account for differences in population sizes, in testing methods or even in total number of tests (+ the unknown figure which is mentioned). Say Germany and the Netherlands are on the curve, it may look similar, but Germany has 4.5x the population of the Netherlands and 10x the testing. So if you look on that graph Germany may show to be far worse than the NL, simply because it is far ahead on the testing, but if you account for the differences in testing and population size the conclusion is the opposite, that the NL is going into a steeper curve than Germany right now (which also seems to be corroborated by the number of deaths comparisons)

snippet.textDisplay: Maybe a better endpoint would be # of people hospitalized, rather than "confirmed cases".  Due to shortage of supplies, many hospitals in the US are only testing those who are sick enough to need hospitalization.  Additionally, not often mentioned in this type of analysis, is that there is a very high false negative rate with the current nucleic acid test.
snippet.textOriginal: Maybe a better endpoint would be # of people hospitalized, rather than "confirmed cases".  Due to shortage of supplies, many hospitals in the US are only testing those who are sick enough to need hospitalization.  Additionally, not often mentioned in this type of analysis, is that there is a very high false negative rate with the current nucleic acid test.

snippet.textDisplay: Sorry! Excellent work but at the point in time you began repeating yourself using China, South Korea, Iran and even Japan (Olympic games), as examples of how ‘they are beating the virus through their measures’ I lost it!  You appear to ignore the fact that by using ‘false data’ from those I’ve just named, it gives a false overall analysis of the patterns. I certainly have some confidence in the patterns of ‘most’ of the other Countries and would have liked to have seen the calculations excluding the misleading data from those mentioned. Thank you anyway, much appreciate your efforts.
snippet.textOriginal: Sorry! Excellent work but at the point in time you began repeating yourself using China, South Korea, Iran and even Japan (Olympic games), as examples of how ‘they are beating the virus through their measures’ I lost it! snippet.textDisplay: The only problem is the data coming out of China.  Since the media there is completely controlled by the government, it would be foolish to accept the data they submit as fact.  Based on how widely it has spread in other countries, like we're seeing in the US now, we should assume that their data is completely false.  The British government has just accused the Chinese of falsifying their data, saying that the real numbers are 15 to 40 times the amount that China has reported.  Since they have been lying every step of the way, I suggest Chinese data be removed to create a more clear picture.
snippet.textOriginal: The only problem is the data coming out of China.  Since the media there is completely controlled by the government, it would be foolish to accept the data they submit as fact.  Based on how widely it has spread in other countries, like we're seeing in the US now, we should assume that their data is completely false.  The British government has just accused the Chinese of falsifying their data, saying that the real numbers are 15 to 40 times the amount that China has reported.  Since they have been lying every step of the way, I suggest Chinese data be removed to create a more clear picture.

snippet.textDisplay: I am right to say that this is 100% Nature's way of reminding us that we can be defeated so easily, so the numbers sort of becoming entertainment (how high will it rise, like a stock market number) We're not the boss, and many of us realize that which is healthy, but 1% of we who outnumber them 99/1 (just an example.
